semantic_title: Combination External Cause Codes for Sequential Events
section_path: Chapter 20: External Causes of Morbidity > a. General External Cause Coding Guidelines > 7) Combination external cause codes

content.full_text: Certain of the external cause codes are combination codes that identify sequential events that result in an injury, such as a fall which results in striking against an object. The injury may be due to either event or both. The combination external cause code used should correspond to the sequence of events regardless of which caused the most serious injury. (Evidence: pg no: 88, L43-L48)
content.summary: Combination external cause codes capture sequential events leading to injury, and should reflect the sequence of events rather than the severity of resulting injuries (Evidence: pg no: 88, L43-L48)
key_concepts: Combination codes for sequential events (Evidence: pg no: 88, L43-L44)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use combination external cause codes for sequential events that result in injury (Evidence: pg no: 88, L43-L44)
detailed_rules.explanation: When multiple events occur in sequence leading to injury, combination codes capture the entire sequence rather than individual events (Evidence: pg no: 88, L43-L45)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Combination code should correspond to sequence of events regardless of injury severity (Evidence: pg no: 88, L47-L48)
detailed_rules.explanation: The selection of combination external cause codes is based on the actual sequence of events, not on which event caused the most serious injury (Evidence: pg no: 88, L47-L48)
